page.title: 18Higher Education West Brom
page.content: Sixth formers, sixteen to eighteen year olds are allowed to specialise in certain subjects, at an advanced level. The maximum of four subjects are studied over a period of two years, with the aim of eventually achieving entry into further education There is more free time in the sixth form for private study or meeting friends in a separate sixth form area. There is a lot of homework to do which restricts the social life of the young people who likes to go out and enjoy themselves at that age. Lack of money is also a problem. Some pupils decide to leave school at sixteen and go to West Bromwich College of Commerce and Technology. Here students are offered a wide range of courses, for example, engineering, catering and office studies.
